description:
Contains essays, pin-ups and shorts stories dedicated to Freedom of Speech

Story Titles

  • A MODEST PROPOSAL by Neil Gaiman
  • THE STORY OF LULU ACCORDING TO HER FEET. The introduction to Neil Gaiman's Guardian Angel Tour Reading at the San Francisco Palace of Fine Arts, by DAVE SIM.
  • KEYNOTE SPEECH by FRANK MILLER
  • THE COMIC BOOK LEGAL DEFENSE FUND by DENIS KITCHEN
  • THE COMICS CODE AUTHORITY

Pin-Up Artists

  • MIKE MIGNOLA
  • WILL EISNER
  • MIKE ALLRED
  • SERGIO ARAGONES
  • ARTHUR ADAMS
  • BILL SIENKIEWICZ
  • ROBERTA GREGORY
  • JEFF SMITH
  • PETER BAGGE
  • DAVE COOPER
  • TROY NIXEY
  • EVAN DORKIN
  • JUDD WINICK
  • RENEE FRENCH
  • MATT WAGNER
  • SHANNON WHEELER
  • BILL TUCCI
  • JAIME HERNENDEZ
  • JIM MAHFOOD

volume.name: Get Carter: The Last Dragon Scout

description:
These were all characters in the only issue published

Gags and Gab by Ray Gill (inside front cover)

The Green Giant by George Kapitan and Harry f. Sahle The Green Giant‚Äôs first and only story in which we are introduced to his ability to grow from his normal height of 6 feet to anything from 8 to 30 feet. When not a giant he has the ability to fly. 8 Pages

Doctor Nerod Super Scientist A super scientist fights villains who seem to be Japanese. 8 pages

Mundoo of the Northwest Good day ah? a macho guy in a check shirt deals with wolves in the Great White North. 6 pages at this point the comic goes from being full color to being printed in black, white & red.

Kar Toon and his Copy Cat. A boy inventor is trying out his hand built camera by taking a picture of a drawing of a cat he has done, there is a band and the cat hops off the page and comes to life, later the cat, who can also talk, is shown to be able to take the form of any animal it has seen 4 pages

Master Mystic A mystery man who‚Äôs name is unknown and who lives in a windowless and doorless tower at the North Pole uses his mastery of ‚Äúmind over matter‚Äù to fight evil, his first foe is Rango of Slavonia a would-be world dictator who perfects a method to turn himself into a giant. 6 pages

The Black Arrow "Magnetic Missiles of Doom!" Air Ace fights in the Pacific. 6 pages. With this and the following strips the comic goes back to full color

Lucky Lane basic cowboy hero. 4 Pages

The Researcher, Like Nerod and I guess Kar Toom for that matter The Researcher (and that seems to be his name) is another brilliant scientist, in his case using super-science items, such as an X-ray flashlight to investigating crimes while wearing a tuxedo 6 pages

Nobby Hobbie 1 page

Fun - O ‚Äì Graphs back page)

The Publisher was called Pelican Publications. They published only one issue. Harry Sahle did the cover art. It was only released in New York City.

The comic was published to see if it could be profitable. The experiment failed due to being unable to obtain a good quality color registration. Mr. Moreau of Moreua Publications who helped to print the book beleived it never hit the stands.
name: Green Giant

person_credits.name: Jim Mahfood
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: Hero By Night is back - one of the most critically acclaimed mini-series of the year returns in a new original series! After Jack King finds the hidden lair and super-powered ring of Steel City's most popular 1940's hero, he must make hard decisions, and a path is begun in what is sure to be one of the most talked about new books this year!

volume.name: How Boys And Girls Can Help Win The War

description: Jenny Finn¬πs new in town, and she's already gainfully employed. A brothel's most prized possession, our young lady is already the talk of the town. Those who don't fear her want to be near her; and some people feel a little bit of both! Secret societies, the battle between good and evil, some high sea adventures, and of course... tentacles. Hellboy creator Mike Mignola and Oni Double Feature/Grendel artist Troy Nixey have put their collective weirdness into one chowder. Set in the combined worlds of Louis Caroll, H.P. Lovecraft, and Captain Ahab, Jenny Finn is a comics experience you aren't likely to forget.

Jack has accepted he wants to be Hero by Night. But he's going to do it right, learn his craft, and start out slow. Wrong! The unstoppable Saul Simian is back, and Jack is his target. It's a race against the clock as Jack juggles being a superhero and have a fiance!"

It's all hit the fan. Roz has learned that Jack has been wearing the Hero ring behind her back, while Jack easily had the snot beat out of him by Saul Simian. But Simian's not done. His bosses want him to go back and finish the job by killing Jack and taking the ring. How can Jack possibly beat Simian once he really means business? The answer may be hidden in the Hero's old journals.

The plague is taking over London, but everyone is too busy looking the other way to do anything about it. Only one man can see through the darkness, but will his vision be enough? On his search for answers and absolution for his part in the supposed death of the whore killer, Joe is taken to a mysterious seance where the spirits are contacted, but the disgusting creatures that arrive aren't quite what he was looking for! At the center of it all, Jenny Finn continues to spread her disease, and she finds the recipients increasingly willing.

Mrs. Claus writes the Claus family letter about her mischievous daughter, Jingle. Although the stories are interesting, they are embarrassing to the family. Finding it difficult to write about the time Jingle got arrested or started a band, Mrs. Claus resorts to eating Bourbon balls to continue writing.

Short story - Santa: Rusty: Jing
written by Robbie B. and Stephen D.

Santa is waiting for Jingle to get ready for the night's sleigh ride while Rusty is being ignored by everyone on his birthday. Rusty finds an unexpected way to draw attention.
name: Winter Wingding

person_credits.name: Scott Morse
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: How does Al and his gang fare when they're chosen to film "The All American Family" documentary?
name: The All American Family or Just Act Natural

description: Includes a poster that has the same image of Kelly Bundy as the cover
name: Beauty and the Beach

description: What's crazier than a coconut? Weapon Kosher, the magic pickle, is set to find out in this all-new, all-ages tale by Scott Morse! When the tropical maniac known as the Loconut goes on a rampage through Hicksville it's up to the Real Dill to save the day! But if the Pickle is out fighting crime, who will help little Jo Jo Wigman woo classmate and all-around cutie Danny Johnson before that meanie Lu Lu Deaderly tricks him into liking her? The answers to all these, plus a load of new questions are all in Magic Pickle #3! Plus, as an added bonus, you get a brand-new Smoke Dog back-up feature by hipster Jim Mahfood!

person_credits.name: Scott Morse
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: The Bundy family wins a trip to Las Vegas. Will they come out as winners?
name: Viva Las Bundys

description: Shocking as it may seem, Peggy starts to work as a nanny. Difficulties ensue.
name: The Nanny Scam, Inc.
One Flew Over the Bundy's Nest

description:
Kelly turns 21 and it's time for her to leave home. Can she make it on her own?

Includes a poster
name: Happy Birthday and Get Out!

description: Polly is caught between the prim-and-proper boarding school set she's grown-up with and the legendary legacy of the Pirate Queen that she never knew she was a part of! Hoist the sails and batten the hatches on this brand new adventure!

The Haunted Tank is back in action, but this time it's an M1 Abrams in modern-day Iraq! African American tank commander Jamal Stuart has his 21st century war ride in full battle rattle and is ready for anything ‚Äì anything except the whistling-Dixie combat guru ghost who shows up uninvited!

Of course, this isn't the first time the spirit of Confederate Civil War General J.E.B. Stuart has helped guide a tank. In times of war he makes himself available to assist his descendants in battle. Jamal Stuart, meet your forefather! It's the newest chapter in the legacy of a long-time DC icon from writer Frank Marraffino (The Dark Goodbye) and artist Henry Flint (OMEGA MEN).
name: Shock and Awesome

description:
Polly continues her curriculum of swashbuckling and treasure seeking in her sensational second issue! Gone are the etiquette and pleasantries of her upperclass boarding school, and in their place are swords, peg legs, and booty*!

*Diamonds, gold etc.

Polly isn't a pirate... yet. But that doesn't mean the crew of the Titania isn't determined to make it so. Maybe the dashing Pirate Prince will have better luck. Or maybe Polly will stay committed to her life of privilege and high society...
Polly's struggle between the prim and proper life she was raised for and the pirate existence that is her destiny continues... But will a peck from the pirate prince tip the scales?¬†

The first adventure of Polly is almost over and she's absolutely no closer to figuring out which life she's truly meant for. Is she destined for swashbuckling adventure like her pirate queen mother or does her future lie with the dandies and ladies of high society? Don't wait to find out!¬†

When ancient giants begin to rise from their graves across England, Hellboy is invited to join a mysterious group called the Wild Hunt and help bring them down. But the hunt leads to betrayal, and Hellboy finds himself up against enemies as angry about what he is as what he's done. "The fading children of the earth" gather in the shadows, waiting for the promised return of the Queen of Blood, and a chance to once again "shake the trees, crack mountains, and make the daytime world weep in fear."
name: The Wild Hunt, Part 1

description: The exciting final issue is here! Polly has been repeatedly kidnapped and attacked, yet her guile has allowed her to not only survive, but dominate. If she lives through this, will she embrace her destiny of being the Pirate Princess, or will she return to her comfortable Victorian order?¬†¬†¬†

volume.name: Rock N Roll Comics: Women In Rock

description:
What would you do if you just turned 19 and find out you've got a demon inside you? And then, to top that off, you suddenly have to fight the Demons of the Senses and save the world... probably at the cost of your own life...

Demons from the Dark Ages have been set free again, but this time they'll have to fight against a new Guardian, Scarlett, who can't come to terms with her new role and ever-growing demonic powers. Fighting Demons is not what she wanted to do, but when her friend is kidnapped and the world is threatened, she has no choice. Under the guidance of an old Irishman who owns an Antique Shop, Elijah, she must fight the demons before it is too late...But the real enemy is closer than she thinks. Soon Scarlett will learn that the very core of her existence is linked to a powerful Demon and a destiny she can't avoid...
name: See No Evil

description:
When Bruce Banner was caught in the blast of an experimental Gamma Bomb, the radiation did not just spawn the incredible beast we know as the Hulk! No indeed, for from that moment grew an entire Hulk Family! From Bruce's cousin She-Hulk to those who've inherited his irradiated genes, Hulk's family tree is looking a little more green all the time. Featuring: the Senstational She-Hulk! Skaar, Son of Hulk! The Daughter of Hulk and Thundra! And the Spectacular Scorpion, who suspects that she, too, might be part of the fam'.

  • Your Lucky Day
  • School For Savages
  • Daughter Of Hulk
  • Emerald Highway
  • The She-Hulk Lives (reprint from The Savage She-Hulk #1)
name: Your Lucky Day; School For Savages; Daughter Of Hulk

description: Set free upon the streets of London, another Demon strikes at the heart of where truth and lies mingle - The Church. No words can save Scarlett from the Demon of Smell; or can they? On the grounds of a cursed cemetery, anything can happen. As Scarlett's Dark source of power breaks through in full force, a new 'gift' is bestowed upon her. But can she control it?
name: Smells Like Demon Spirit

description: The big day has finally arrived for Popeye & Olive, and everybody is showing up for it.

Andrew Sphinx believes the human face is the ultimate canvas, and that cosmetic surgeons are the artists of a new age. But as Dr. David Scholem prepares to operate, cracks begin to appear in the idyllic facade of Sphinx's tropical island.

Face is a giant-sized one-shot published by DC Vertigo's 'Vertigo Voices' imprint/promotion in the mid-90's helmed by writer Peter Milligan and artist Duncan Fegredo.

Face is a twisted horror story about a demented reclusive artist who hires an expert plastic surgeon to essentially give his face the 'Picasso' treatment.
name: Face

description: If Thessaly is dead, and the coalition of homeless death gods has won, then what could possibly happen in this final issue of THE THESSALIAD? A big victory party perhaps? If that's the case, before you mix the punch and blow up the balloons, make sure there are no uninvited guests, including any ghosts who're feeling sick from overeating.
name: Part 4: Soul Food or So Much for Clever Hidden Plans

description: Thess and Fetch hunt monsters while keeping a careful eye out for the 3rd Guardian. But before Thess can accept the challenge, she becomes just another statue in this giant topiary garden from Hell. Meanwhile, the death gods are debating their own abilities against a millennia-old witch, and whether or not they can trust the ghost they've sent to trick her.
name: Part 3: Necromancer or What Ever Made You Think Ghosts Carry Money?

description: The dark fantasy quest continues as Thessaly, a practical but deadly witch, and her annoying ghost sidekick, Fetch, ride the ever- changing Allegorical Subway. Each stop not only reveals a dangerous challenge between gatekeeper and traveler but also boasts cameos from some surprising characters from THE SANDMAN. Plus, ritual magic rules as the homeless gods who are hunting Thessaly get closer to their prey.
name: Part 2: The Long Crawl or the Trouble with Riddle Games

description: Thessaly, the fan-favorite character from The Sandman: A Game Of You, returns in a new mini-series by Bill Willingham and Shawn McManus. A cantankerous creature known as Fetch is sent to capture Thess and prepare her as the last supper for a pact of homeless gods. But Fetch and Thessaly both end up being chased while travelling from the fractured streets of Manhattan to the mercurial realms beneath the subway. The most powerful Thessalian witch ever may have finally met her match.
name: Part 1: The Daughters of Garm or Far too Much About Pie

description:
The shocking conclusion of the Re-Animator story is here!
Cassie has finally has found her dad but the dream of a family will shatter as her mom will prove to be beyond sanity and redemption. Meanwhile, the Nef Lords sent a fierce (and busty) assassin to Earth to capture Cassie. Definitely, things will get very ugly.
name: Cassie and Vlad meet the Re-Animator. Part 3 of 3

description: America‚Äôs Greatest Comics #1- $6.95 First issue of a new Golden Age reprint anthology title that runs the gamut of story types, every one rendered by an all-time great illustrator! For fans of the costumed super-types, it‚Äôs Fox Features‚Äô sexy Phantom Lady, by Matt Baker, in ‚ÄúThe Fire Fiend!‚Äù, and The Dollman, who uses a model plane to bring crooks down to size in a tale drawn by Lou Fine!! For jungle fans, there‚Äôs Thunda, King of the Congo facing ‚ÄúThe Terror of the Tusks‚Äù, with Bob Powell art. Like horror stories? Try Joe Kubert‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Curse of Khar!‚Äù, or Steve Ditko‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Man Below‚Äù- a tale narrated by The Mysterious Traveller. The King is celebrated in a spooky fantasy, as Jack Kirby and partner Joe Simon provide ‚ÄúBirth After Death!‚Äù If glamorous ‚Äúgood girl art‚Äù is your thing, we‚Äôve got the sizzling Torchy, by creator Bill Ward. See how her job as secretary to a voice teacher leads to her losing her clothes! For the more military-minded, check out Doug Wildey‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Pool of Peril‚Äù, a a supernatural mystery set in WWII. As is the AC standard, all these full stories, reprinted from such publishers as Quality. Magazine Enterprises, Avon, Prize Charlton and others, are reproduced in the highest quality possible. 52 pages, black and white with color covers. Standard comic book format.

name: Skull Beneath the Skin/Rattlehead/Looking Down the Cross

description: Comicdom‚Äôs top Golden Age anthology is back, with a plethora of high-quality reprints to satisfy every taste! If you like superheroes, there‚Äôs Bob Powell‚Äôs Strongman, in ‚ÄúThe Deluge‚Äù. Western‚Äôs your bag? We‚Äôve got Dick Ayer‚Äôs original Ghost Rider, The Haunted Horseman in ‚ÄúThe Man From Scotland Yard‚Äù Horror fans will love Harry Lazarus‚Äô simulated 3D art on ‚ÄúThe Wolpire‚Äù, and Steve Ditko‚Äôs spooky Mysterious Traveler in ‚ÄúAbove The Topmost Peak‚Äù. Historical adventure in the colonial days comes via White Indian in ‚ÄúThe Trail of the Traitor‚Äù, illustrated by none other than Frank Frazetta, and Good Girl art fans get a double treat, with that sensual siren Mysta of the Moon , as illustated by Don Cameron, versus the evil Karrin, and international intrigue in Senorita Rio and ‚ÄúThe Vapors of Madness!‚Äù (drawn by Jack Kamen!!) Reprising the best material of the 1940‚Ä≤s and ‚Äô50‚Ä≤s, from comics publishers like Fiction House, Magazine Enterprises, Charlton and ACG, in beautiful full-story reprints. 52 pages, black and white with color covers, standard comic book format.

More superb Golden Age reprints, this issue‚Äôs focus on Fawcatt Comics. Headlining is Spy Smasher as he busts up a Nazi sabotage plot ! Ibis the Invincible fights a coven of cat-worshippers! There‚Äôs jungle action with serial favorite Nyoka the Jungle Girl, and slam-bang action with Mr. Scarlet and Pinky. Bulletman and Bulletgirl fly high to fight the evil Dr. Weird, while El Carim, Master of Magic uses his powers against a gang of thugs. Six superb stories from the Fabulous ‚ÄòForties, with art by Dan Barry, George Tuska, Kurt Schaffenberger, Bob Fugitani and Emil Gershwin. 52 pages, black and white with color covers, standard comic book format.

This is entire volume is dedicated to the Golden Age career of artist Alex Toth, who actively participated in the production of this book. Starting off behind a brand-new, never-before-seen Toth cover, We get an indepth and profusely-illustrated overview of Alex‚Äôs work at Dell Publications, including his movie/TV adaptations like The Land Unkown, Seahunt, Disney‚Äôs Clint and Mac, The Lennon Sisters, Darby O‚ÄôGill and The Little People, The Real McCoys, Oh, Susanna, Danny Thomas ; and special focus on 77 Sunset Strip. Then, it‚Äôs Alex‚Äôs work on Roy Rogers and other big and small-screen stars, including Frontier Doctor, Maverick, and Sugarfoot. Next, a full-story reprint from Buster Crabbe Comics, ‚Äù Invisible Monsters of Callisto‚Äù, followed by Harry Thomas‚Äôs extensive article on Alex‚Äôs Western work, on Johnny Thunder and other strips; ‚ÄúThunder In The West‚Äù. A complete checklist of all the Toth reprints that AC Comics has printed follows that, then another rare full-story reprint- the VERY rare ‚ÄúDanny Dreams‚Äù. Finally, an illustrated article on Alex‚Äôs ‚Äúdog days‚Äù- his work on Streak, The Wonder Dog, and Rex, The Wonder Dog. There have been many books and articles on Toth‚Äôs work appearing over the last few years; this book takes on projects not discussed in those other venues. Excellent text on little-seen aspects of Toth‚Äôs carrer, written by comics historian, Bill Black. 52 pages, black & white with color covers; standard comic-book size, printed in 2004.

The spotlight is on Spiderman co-creator and all-time great, artist Steve Ditko, and his atmospheric and macabre renderings this issue. Focusing on Steve‚Äôs early career producing horror and fantasy stories originally seen at Charlton Comics in the mid-1950‚Ä≤s, this collection reprises ‚Äú3-D: Disaster, Doom, Death‚Äù from This Magazine is Haunted #17, ‚ÄúThe Man Who Painted On Air‚Äù, ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs Coming For Me‚Äù; and ‚ÄúThe Night of the Red Snow‚Äùfrom other issues of that title, the short fantasy feature ‚ÄúThe Shadow‚Äù, and a collaborative effort from Prize Comic‚Äôs Black Magic title wherupon Ditko inks the pencils of Jack Kirby on a gritty war story, ‚ÄúGuard Duty‚Äù. Also, another Simon/Kirby Black Magic team-up, ‚ÄúThose Who Are About To Die‚Äù, and an Alex Toth-drawn masterpiece from Lev Gleason‚Äôs Buster Crabbe Comics, ‚ÄúKiller On The Loose‚Äù All full-story reprints, crisp and clean. 52 pages, black & white with color covers. Standard comic book size.
